title: 9 Profitable Amazon KDP Keywords for the Factbook Niche | Low Competition + High Demand Ideas

tactics.name: Keyword Research with Tools
tactics.description: Use Chrome extensions to analyze keyword performance and identify low competition, high demand keywords for KDP.
steps: Install and configure Amazon Scout Pro and Publisher Rocket
Analyze keyword BSR, review counts, and keyword scores
Filter results based on competition and demand thresholds
caveats: Requires accurate tool configuration for reliable data
source_quotes: we're going to use a total of four free Chrome extensions to analyze the results

tactics.name: Content Segmentation Strategy
tactics.description: Create targeted content by dividing topics into age-specific or skill-level categories.
steps: Structure content around sub-niches (e.g., Python, Linux)
caveats: Requires market validation of sub-niche demand
source_quotes: we can make the book for children we can make the book for adults

tactics.name: Subniche Targeting
tactics.description: Focus on specific age groups (children 8-12, adults) within the factbook niche to differentiate content structure and audience.
source_quotes: the best age is to start from 8 to 12 years old

tactics.name: Long-Tail Keyword Optimization
tactics.description: Leverage specific keywords with lower competition and higher demand for factbook niches.
steps: Use as subtitle for main title
source_quotes: beautiful long tail keyword that has everything we need to know

tactics.name: keyword diversification
tactics.description: Create multiple books within a niche to diversify sales and reduce reliance on single keywords
steps: Identify a core keyword with strong metrics
Leverage free trial resources for cover/interior assets
source_quotes: create a book that fulfills the promise of the title and move on to creating the next book

tactics.name: Leverage Existing Factbook Titles
tactics.description: Add high-demand keywords to existing factbook titles or create new books targeting niche topics with low competition.
steps: Add the keyword to the seven keyword slots of existing factbook titles
Create a new book featuring the exact topic (e.g., '100 things to know about planet Earth')
Opt for Kindle Select to enable royalty earnings without print costs
caveats: Requires consistent content quality to maintain engagement
source_quotes: you can adapt the same strategies that I've talked about which includes if you currently have any sort of Factbook in your KDP portfolio go ahead and add this to the seven keyword slots

heuristics.name: Low Competition Signal
heuristics.condition: If keyword BSR is below 100,000 and review count under 200, prioritize
source_quotes: total results under 1,000 BSR is also within that 400,000 range

heuristics.name: BSR-Review Correlation
heuristics.condition: If BSR exceeds 100,000 but reviews are above $200, prioritize content quality over ranking
source_quotes: the best seller rank is 4269 54 which is within that 400,000 range

heuristics.name: review_volume_heuristic
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, prioritize keywords with higher review counts
source_quotes: average reviews are 1,845 which are much more larger than the total reviews

heuristics.name: Review-Driven Optimization
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize keywords with high engagement potential
source_quotes: average reviews are whooping 358 because the engagement for these kinds of high content books are quite high

Factbook niches with 100+ topic structures show consistent sales patterns

claims.statement: High-content factbook titles with 350+ reviews demonstrate strong engagement patterns on KDP
